scraper.utils

Class Document

  • java.lang.Object
    • scraper.utils.Document

  • public class Document
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a full HTML document made up of a series of elements. It provides methods for loading a document from a web-page, a local file, or a String of HTML tags. Documents can be queried to retrieve elements that match a given tag.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Document()
      Creates an empty document object whose contents have not been loaded yet.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Elements getElementsByTag(java.lang.String tag)
      Retrieves a (potentially empty) collection of Elements from this Document that match a specified HTML tag.
      boolean loadPageFromHTML(java.lang.String theHTML)
      Loads a static string of HTML into this Document to enable queries to be performed.
      boolean loadPageFromURL(java.lang.String theURL)
      Loads the contents of a webpage into this Document based on an absolute URL (ie., including the http:// or https:// portion).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Document

        public Document()
        Creates an empty document object whose contents have not been loaded yet.

    • Method Detail

      • loadPageFromHTML

        public boolean loadPageFromHTML(java.lang.String theHTML)
        Loads a static string of HTML into this Document to enable queries to be performed.
        Parameters:
        theHTML - A string of well-formed HTML to be parsed by the Document.
        Returns:
        true if the specified HTML was successfully loaded by the Document; false if an error occurred while loading.

      • loadPageFromURL

        public boolean loadPageFromURL(java.lang.String theURL)
        Loads the contents of a webpage into this Document based on an absolute URL (ie., including the http:// or https:// portion).
        Parameters:
        theURL - An absolute URL for the page to be loaded into this Document.
        Returns:
        true if the HTML for the corresponding URL was successfully loaded by the Document; false if an error occurred while loading.

      • getElementsByTag

        public Elements getElementsByTag(java.lang.String tag)
        Retrieves a (potentially empty) collection of Elements from this Document that match a specified HTML tag. For example, specifying a tag of "img" will retrieve a collection of all image elements from the document. A tag of "div" would retrieve all division elements.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag to be searched for within the document.
        Returns:
        A collection of the matching elements.
